awd_titl_txt: Synthetic and Mechanistic Studies on Hypervalent Iodine     Complexes
awd_abstract_narration: This research program of Dr. Robert M. Moriarty in the                          Department of Chemistry at the University of Illinois at                        Chicago will be supported by the Organic Synthesis Program. The                 principal investigator will study the reactions of hypervalent                  iodine compounds.  The use of these novel reagents for                          promoting carbon-carbon bond formation will be stressed by                      probing  allylation, vinylation and alkylation reactions on                     substrates including pyrimidine and purine nucleosides.                                                                                                         Interest in hypervalent iodine chemistry is based on the fact                   that the reactivity pattern of I(III) reagents resembles that                   of Pb(IV), Tl(III) and Hg(II).  Further, due to the mechanism                   of of I(III) reactions involving ligand exchange and reductive                  elimination, similarities exist between I(III) chemistry and                    the organometallic chemistry of Pd, Pt and Ni.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
